content:
• Wednesday, June 20, 2012
  • EGLE

    Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE) +14.1% AH after reaching a debt restructuring deal. $1.13B in...

    Eagle Bulk Shipping (NASDAQ:EGLE) +14.1% AH after reaching a debt restructuring deal. $1.13B in debt outstanding through a revolving credit facility will be turned into a term loan due at the end of 2015, with a possible 18-month extension. Eagle will receive a new $20M credit facility, and all debt outstanding via its current credit agreement will carry an interest rate of LIBOR plus 6%. Creditors will receive warrants convertible into common stock equal to 20% of current outstanding shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ1 earnings call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of $320M-$322M and...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) guides on its FQ1 earnings call (webcast) for FQ2 revenue of $320M-$322M and EPS of $0.28-$0.29, largely below a consensus of $330.8M and $0.29. FY13 (ends in February) revenue guidance is now at $1.32B-$1.34B, slightly below prior guidance of $1.34B-$1.36B. Red Hat claims forex issues had much to do with its Q/Q deferred revenue decline, but analysts are quick to raise questions about demand. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • SUNH

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) resumes trading +35.2% AH after announcing it agreed to be acquired...

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) resumes trading +35.2% AH after announcing it agreed to be acquired by Genesis HealthCare for $8.50/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • POZN

    Pozen (NASDAQ:POZN) resumes trading -18.1% AH after the FDA said the company's Phase 1 study...

    Pozen (NASDAQ:POZN) resumes trading -18.1% AH after the FDA said the company's Phase 1 study failed to demonstrate the bioequivalence of PA32540 to enteric-coated aspirin 325 mg using acetylsalicylic acid as the analyte, and further study will be needed.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • ONXX

    An FDA panel votes 11-0 in favor of the risk/benefit assessment for Onyx Pharmaceuticals'...

    An FDA panel votes 11-0 in favor of the risk/benefit assessment for Onyx Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:ONXX) Kyprolis (carfilzomib) cancer drug for multiple myeloma. ONXX shares have been halted since ~12:30, but Ligand Pharma (NASDAQ:LGND), which is due to receive milestone payments and royalties for the drug, rose 12.8% during regular trading and is +3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -5.8%) finished the day off sharply. Possibly hurting its cause was a column...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU -5.8%) finished the day off sharply. Possibly hurting its cause was a column from SA's Richard N. Davis, who questions the usage figures Qihoo cites for its web browser's home page (its main source of revenue), given the lack of third-party confirmation, and indications from third-party sources that growth is minimal. Qihoo, which recently saw a CFO shakeup, has been a frequent target of Citron Research.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • SUNH

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) announces it has signed an agreement to be purchased by Genesis...

    Sun Healthcare (NASDAQ:SUNH) announces it has signed an agreement to be purchased by Genesis HealthCare for $8.50/share in cash, a 38.4% premium to today's close. Shares are halted AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • BBBY

    More on Bed Bath and Beyond's (NASDAQ:BBBY) Q1: Earnings beat expectations but lower guidance -...

    More on Bed Bath and Beyond's (NASDAQ:BBBY) Q1: Earnings beat expectations but lower guidance - Q2 EPS seen at $0.97-$1.03 vs. an expected $1.08 - has sent the stock tumbling after hours, -9.9%. Same-store sales up about 3%; company sees full-year EPS growth in "high single to low double digits."
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • SONC

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $149M (-1.8% Y/Y) in-line....

    Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $149M (-1.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): FQ1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $314.7M (+19% Y/Y) beats by...

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): FQ1 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $314.7M (+19% Y/Y) beats by $3.9M. Deferred revenue totaled $913.3M at quarter's end, up 16% Y/Y but down 4% Q/Q. Shares -11.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q1 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2.22B (+5% Y/Y)...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY): Q1 EPS of $0.89 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2.22B (+5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -10.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • MITL

    Mitel Networks (MITL +7.6%) holds solidly in the green after its FQ4 easily beat estimates...

    Mitel Networks (MITL +7.6%) holds solidly in the green after its FQ4 easily beat estimates yesterday. Net income soared as the online-communications company saw higher deferred income-tax recoveries and better-than-expected sales buoy results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • WCN

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN +2.4%) is no garbage stock, RBC says in raising its rating to...

    Progressive Waste Solutions (BIN +2.4%) is no garbage stock, RBC says in raising its rating to Top Pick from Outperform. The selloff in shares on concerns of a "price war" in the waste management industry are unwarranted, the firm says; with BIN trading at historical lows, "we believe a contrarian view will be well rewarded."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • LQDT

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -8.9%) takes a hit after CFO James Rallo commented at a Stifel Nicolaus...

    Liquidity Services (LQDT -8.9%) takes a hit after CFO James Rallo commented at a Stifel Nicolaus conference yesterday that the company may not continue to see the level of margin expansion that it experienced recently. Stifel Nicolaus says the weakness is a buying opportunity, parroting earlier comments by Oppenheimer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.5%) says retail sales of machines for the three-month rolling period ending...

    Caterpillar (CAT -2.5%) says retail sales of machines for the three-month rolling period ending in May rose 11% across all world regions, vs. +12% for the three-month rolling period ending April and +18% for the three months ending March. For the May rolling period, sales +5% in Asia/Pacific, +4% in Europe/Africa/Middle East, +31% in North America, -6% in Latin America.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 7 Comments
  • GNMX

    Shares of Medgenics (MDGN +25%) soar after the company says its Infradure Biopump has received...

    Shares of Medgenics (MDGN +25%) soar after the company says its Infradure Biopump has received an Orphan Drug Designation from the FDA to treat hepatitis D. The designation carries multiple benefits, including the availability of grant money, certain tax credits and seven years of market exclusivity, as well as the possibility of an expedited regulatory process. Seeking Alpha contributor Ray Dirks says the designation makes it a prime takeout target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • AMAT

    Praise continues to pour in for Applied Materials' (AMAT +2.5%) selection of Gary Dickerson as...

    Praise continues to pour in for Applied Materials' (AMAT +2.5%) selection of Gary Dickerson as its new president; he previously ran Varian Semiconductor, regarded as one of the sector's best-run firms. Barclays calls Dickerson "a strategic thinker, data driven, decisive." Pacific Crest calls the move "the kind of change that could get investors excited about the stock again." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • JBL

    Though its FQ3 revenues missed estimates and its FQ4 guidance was slightly below expectations,...

    Though its FQ3 revenues missed estimates and its FQ4 guidance was slightly below expectations, contract manufacturer Jabil (JBL +6.8%) is shooting higher. Investors may have assumed the company, which sports a single-digit P/E, would offer a gloomier outlook given worries about slowing mobile phone and IT hardware demand. UBS expects strong orders from Apple (Jabil's only 10%+ customer) to give 2H sales a lift, even as orders from RIM and Cisco decline. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • GEVO

    Cowen weighs in on Gevo (GEVO +20%), upgrading the stock to Outperform on the back of the U.S....

    Cowen weighs in on Gevo (GEVO +20%), upgrading the stock to Outperform on the back of the U.S. District Court's denial of Butamax's request for a preliminary injunction, and the announcement yesterday that it's collaborating to produce cellulosic isobutanol in Malaysia.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • HII

    Huntington Ingalls (HII +2.3%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Goldman this...

    Huntington Ingalls (HII +2.3%) gains on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Goldman this morning, citing the Navy's better than anticipated chunk of the DoD budget and its potential for more contract deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • GNMK

    Medical diagnostic testing systems provider GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK -3.2%) recovers somewhat...

    Medical diagnostic testing systems provider GenMark Diagnostics (GNMK -3.2%) recovers somewhat after dropping over 9% earlier this morning on the announcement of a 10M share secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • SJM

    Even though shares of J.M. Smucker (SJM -0.2%) are getting spread thin after Procter &...

    Even though shares of J.M. Smucker (SJM -0.2%) are getting spread thin after Procter & Gamble set its sales and profit targets lower, Barron's is calling for a run up in shares on the back of its strong brands. A strong peanut crop and lower coffee prices should both help relieve margin pressure and help present a strong case that valuation on SJM sits too low.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.3%) slumps after confirming it has begun conducting layoffs as part...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.3%) slumps after confirming it has begun conducting layoffs as part of its restructuring efforts. There may be concerns the job cuts won't go far enough - the WSJ reports RIM's layoffs have thus far involved letting go of "small batches of employees" at a time. More clarity may be provided when RIM delivers its FQ1 report on June 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • MEG

    Media General (MEG -3.7%) takes a hit from a two-notch downgrade to Underperform at Imperial...

    Media General (MEG -3.7%) takes a hit from a two-notch downgrade to Underperform at Imperial Capital Imperial Capital this morning, citing high leverage and limited free cash flow problems. The firm also lowers its price target to $3.50 from $4.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • AIR

    Shares of aircraft leasing and maintenance company AAR Corp. (AIR +6.6%) are on the rise after...

    Shares of aircraft leasing and maintenance company AAR Corp. (AIR +6.6%) are on the rise after both its chairman/CEO and president added to their stakes in the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • HUN

    The recent pullback in Huntsman (HUN -1.3%) provides buying opportunity, says Lazard Capital....

    The recent pullback in Huntsman (HUN -1.3%) provides buying opportunity, says Lazard Capital. The firm says concerns about the company's exposure to Europe are overdone and reiterates a Buy on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • ETH

    Shares of Ethan Allen (ETH -11.1%) sink after investors digest the FQ4 report from rival...

    Shares of Ethan Allen (ETH -11.1%) sink after investors digest the FQ4 report from rival La-Z-Boy showing that furniture sales are weakening. Also: STLY -1.8%, HOFT -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.5%) slips after Needham downgrades shares to Buy from Strong Buy, arguing...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS -2.5%) slips after Needham downgrades shares to Buy from Strong Buy, arguing the company's 90% YTD return (compared with just 2% for chip stocks in general) warrants some profit-taking. The firm also points out Cirrus' heavy dependence on Apple (iPhone/iPad audio codec chip sales make up the majority of its revenue) could prove a dual-edged sword.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • PVAC

    After surging 27% in the past week, Penn Virginia (PVA -5.4%) shares slide after CapitalOne...

    After surging 27% in the past week, Penn Virginia (PVA -5.4%) shares slide after CapitalOne issues a downgrade to Neutral. Since the firm upgraded shares in April, PVA posted a Q1 loss that wasn't as bad as analysts feared and revenue also topped estimates as the company benefits from a shift to oil and natural gas liquids, driven by its Eagle Ford shale play.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • PG

    Procter & Gamble's (PG -3%) weakness is not a buying opportunity, says Morgan Stanley,...

    Procter & Gamble's (PG -3%) weakness is not a buying opportunity, says Morgan Stanley, noting the company's new guidance isn't conservative enough given its lack of repurchases, higher pension expense, and negative FX considerations. The firm maintains its Equal Weight rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • AONEQ

    It's make-or-break time for A123 Systems (AONE), according to Automotive News' Dustin Walsh. If...

    It's make-or-break time for A123 Systems (AONE), according to Automotive News' Dustin Walsh. If the hype from the firm is correct over its lithium-ion battery that can deliver 10X the life of traditional lead acid batteries and withstand temperature extremes, then it's a game-changer. But without additional funding or a slew of new contracts, the naysayers may be proven correct. Shares of AONE +9.1% after aides with Obama make positive comments about fuel cell technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 7 Comments

  • Gold and oil don't seem to expect much from the FOMC today, the metal -1.2% and WTI crude -1.8%....

    Gold and oil don't seem to expect much from the FOMC today, the metal -1.2% and WTI crude -1.8%. Crude added to already solid losses on the release of storage data showing an unexpected build in inventories.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 13 Comments
  • KEX

    Kirby (KEX -1.6%) slides after RBC Capital cut the shares to Outperform from its Top Pick list,...

    Kirby (KEX -1.6%) slides after RBC Capital cut the shares to Outperform from its Top Pick list, citing near-term guidance concerns, higher maintenance expenses, and dislocation in the fracing markets. The firm also lowers its price target to $65 from $80.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -7.1%) slumps to multi-year lows following a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies'...

    Acme Packet (APKT -7.1%) slumps to multi-year lows following a downgrade to Hold from Jefferies' James Kisner. After conducting checks, Kisner is worried the near-term unwillingness of North American carriers (i.e. AT&T and Verizon) to invest in their wireline networks, in favor of spending more on mobile, will make it hard for Acme to hit 2H estimates. Acme has already crashed due to delayed North American orders, and F5 and Finisar have recently been hit by concerns about soft telco capex.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Rare earth stocks (REMX +1%) extend yesterday's gains as rumors of tighter regulation on rare...

    Rare earth stocks (REMX +1%) extend yesterday's gains as rumors of tighter regulation on rare earth mining production from Chinese authorities gain traction, with a new report from Xinhua sparking further interest today. MCP +8.8%, REE +6.8%, AVL +5.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +2.9%) jumps after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral,...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +2.9%) jumps after Goldman Sachs upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral, taking a positive view of MPC's management team, its "integrated, high-quality asset base" and growing “social contract” with investors to return excess cash. The firm also downgraded COP and WNR, raised TSO, and reiterated its Conviction Buy rating for HFC. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Cisco (CSCO +2.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Outperform from BMO's Tim Long, who thinks the...

    Cisco (CSCO +2.2%) rallies on an upgrade to Outperform from BMO's Tim Long, who thinks the strength of the company's data center offerings will drive growth. Long adds new Cisco switches have "stymied competitors" such as JNPR and HPQ, and the company is gaining share in the lucrative core router market. The data center networking market has seen healthy growth in recent quarters, as the adoption of cloud services and virtualization help drive demand for costlier 10G equipment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • PNNT

    PennantPark Investment (PNNT +2.1%), basks in an upgrade to Outperform from FBR Capital.

    PennantPark Investment (PNNT +2.1%), basks in an upgrade to Outperform from FBR Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • SODA

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +5.8%) continue to trade higher on heavy volume with positive...

    Shares of Sodastream (SODA +5.8%) continue to trade higher on heavy volume with positive comments from Monness Crespi about its channel checks helping to provided a lift and chatter that shorts are starting to get squeezed. (Earlier: KO vs. SODA)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • ATHN

    athenahealth (ATHN -2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at Sterne Agee this morning based...

    athenahealth (ATHN -2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at Sterne Agee this morning based on increasing labor costs needed to grow its installed base on clinicals, and the pressure it's likely to put on margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • SIGM

    Activist fund Potomac Capital, which owns an 8% stake in Sigma Designs (SIGM -4.2%), issues an...

    Activist fund Potomac Capital, which owns an 8% stake in Sigma Designs (SIGM -4.2%), issues an open letter that reiterates its nomination of three board members. Potomac airs a long list of complaints it has about Sigma's board and management, including a history of losses and equity dilution, and alleged conflicts of interest. Sigma recently terminated a poison pill and agreed to split it chairman and CEO roles in response to pressure from Potomac.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (NASDAQ:SODA) rips a 6.9% gain as Coca-Cola's (KO -0.5%) legal efforts to quiet the...

    Sodastream (NASDAQ:SODA) rips a 6.9% gain as Coca-Cola's (KO -0.5%) legal efforts to quiet the company over its claims about the environmental effects of billions of cans and bottle backfire in a way. At least a few traders think that Coca-Cola's public squabbling with Sodastream has helped investors differentiate the name from beaten-up Green Mountain Coffee Roasters.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • CIM

    Chimera Investment (CIM -5.2%) falls sharply after declaring a Q2 dividend of $0.09/share, down...

    Chimera Investment (CIM -5.2%) falls sharply after declaring a Q2 dividend of $0.09/share, down from $0.11 in Q1. It's the 2nd dividend cut in 3 quarters on top of the recent firing of its auditor (the company has yet to file its 2011 10K or Q1 10Q). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 3 Comments
  • LZB

    Shares of La-Z-Boy (LZB -8.1%) sink after its FQ4 report highlights a trend of declining revenue...

    Shares of La-Z-Boy (LZB -8.1%) sink after its FQ4 report highlights a trend of declining revenue for the furniture maker. It's been a big swing in the price action of LZB, which traded up 4% in AH trading last night following the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • SHO

    Sunstone Hotel Investors (SHO -1.5%) announces plans to sell 11M shares of its common stock at...

    Sunstone Hotel Investors (SHO -1.5%) announces plans to sell 11M shares of its common stock at $10.45/share, looking to use the money to fund its planned $91.75M purchase of the 357-room Hilton Garden Inn Chicago Downtown/Magnificent Mile.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (LPSN -6.4%), which made new highs yesterday, is tumbling thanks to a downgrade to...

    LivePerson (LPSN -6.4%), which made new highs yesterday, is tumbling thanks to a downgrade to Neutral from Janney. Shares had rallied in recent weeks on the back of positive analyst commentary, and hopes the company will become part of the giant M&A wave (I, II, III) hitting the enterprise cloud software market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (ADBE -6.1%) dives thanks to the soft FQ3 guidance included within its FQ2 report; JMP and...

    Adobe (ADBE -6.1%) dives thanks to the soft FQ3 guidance included within its FQ2 report; JMP and Atlantic Securities are downgrading shares in response. Also, Credit Suisse (Neutral) is worried the implied guidance for FQ4 is "relatively aggressive." During its earnings call, Adobe boasted promotions helped it end FQ2 with over 90K paid subs for its closely-watched Creative Cloud platform, and that 65% of paid subs are subscribing to the entire Creative Cloud suite.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) roar to a 5.1% gain after Goldman Sach raises its price...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) roar to a 5.1% gain after Goldman Sach raises its price target to $50 and cites positive catalysts including the highly-anticipated launch of the Model S sedan. With only 5K models set to hit the road this year, it may be the critical industry reviews (still waiting on) as much as the raw sales numbers that tip the scales for the model's future.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 11 Comments
  • JPM

    JPMorgan (JPM +1.8%) pops at the open, helped by a report the recently strong financial markets...

    JPMorgan (JPM +1.8%) pops at the open, helped by a report the recently strong financial markets have allowed it to unload 65-70% of its money-bleeding London Whale position.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • WBA

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) move down 1.9% premarket after taking on a downgrade from both Argus...

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG) move down 1.9% premarket after taking on a downgrade from both Argus and Macquarie. The loss comes on top of a 5.9% hit yesterday. At its current trading price, WAG's price-earnings ratio is in single digits and its yield crossed over the 3% mark.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 4 Comments
  • ATU

    More on Actuant (NYSE:ATU) FQ3: net profit -5.4% to $34.4M, including a $16.8M debt refinancing...

    More on Actuant (NYSE:ATU) FQ3: net profit -5.4% to $34.4M, including a $16.8M debt refinancing charge. Sales breakdown: engine and valve production +8%, industrial +2.1%, energy +24%, electrical +7%. Guidance: FY 2012 EPS $2.03-$2.08, revenue $1.6B-$1.61B vs. consensus of $2.27 and $1.7B. FY 2013 EPS of $2.15-$2.30, revenue of $1.67B-$1.7B vs. consensus of $2.27 and $1.7B. Shares -5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are higher ahead of the latest FOMC policy decision today, with...

    Market preview: Stock futures are higher ahead of the latest FOMC policy decision today, with many economists expecting the Fed to extend "Operation Twist," although Lance Roberts reckons they'll be disappointed. The S&P Benchmark is +0.2%. Adobe is -6.8% after it gave weak guidance, although P&G is just -1.5% after it did the same. Later: Mass Layoffs
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • IDIX

    Premarket gainers: IDIX +15%. GALE +5%. Losers: ADBE -7%. NBG -6%. CIM -6%.

    Premarket gainers: IDIX +15%. GALE +5%.
    Losers: ADBE -7%. NBG -6%. CIM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD), which had rallied  over 60% from its 52-week low during the last...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD), which had rallied over 60% from its 52-week low during the last couple of weeks thanks to M&A hopes, is down 7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) +1.6% premarket, perhaps attributable to a Financial Times story...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) +1.6% premarket, perhaps attributable to a Financial Times story suggesting Sinopec (NYSE:SNP) may be interested in bidding for billions of dollars worth of assets owned by CHK. SNP CEO Fu Chengyu was in Oklahoma this week in connection with the company’s due diligence on the CHK assets, FT reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • RIOT

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY) -36.5% premarket after announcing it will sell 6.1M common shares at...

    AspenBio Pharma (APPY) -36.5% premarket after announcing it will sell 6.1M common shares at $2/share, a 36% discount to Tuesday's closing price. APPY plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including a clinical trial for AppyScore, a test in development designed to help physicians manage emergency room patients suspected of having acute appendicitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) +14.2% premarket after providing positive clinical data...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) +14.2% premarket after providing positive clinical data from an ongoing Phase 2b study of its lead hepatitis C drug, IDX184, showing suppression of the virus.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • CLSN

    Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) +3.6% premarket after CEO Michael Tardugno tells Reuters his company...

    Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN) +3.6% premarket after CEOMichael Tardugno tells Reuters his company has a $1B cancer therapy with its ThermoDox treatment for liver cancer. CLSN, with a market cap of only ~$73M and just 16 employees, aims to place an old cancer drug into a new delivery method and adding heat in a recipe for success that can address a large unmet need in cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +18% after a Delaware District Court denies Butamax Advanced Biofuels'...

    Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO) +18% after a Delaware District Court denies Butamax Advanced Biofuels' request for a preliminary injunction against Gevo over IP violation claims. The injunction replaces a previous court order and allows Gevo to "sell in any market, to any customer, in any region." (previous) (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • PG

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) tilt 1.85% lower after the company cuts its outlook for...

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) tilt 1.85% lower after the company cuts its outlook for profits. CEO Bob McDonald says the company won't cut spending on R&D and advertising or exit any emerging markets due to the slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 AM | 1 Comment

    China Unicom (NYSE:CHU) -3.7% in Hong Kong trading after announcing it added a net 2.73M 3G...

    China Unicom (NYSE:CHU) -3.7% in Hong Kong trading after announcing it added a net 2.73M 3G subscribers in May, a 6.6% decrease in subscriber growth from April. Analysts attributed the results to weaker consumer spending. The news prompted BofA to cut the company’s 2012 net income forecast by 18%.
